statement: Eurozone Dec final mfg PMI 48.8; Germany final 47.0 with export orders notably weak.
market_link: EU manufacturing contraction can weigh global risk tone and support duration demand; also relevant for EUR (6E) and USD (DX).

statement: NY Fed standing repo facility usage spiked to a reported record $74.6B on Dec 31 amid year-end funding needs.
market_link: Highlights calendar-driven front-end funding tightness; watch whether usage normalizes post-turn for rates/liquidity tone.

statement: Eurozone M3 y/y 3.0% in Nov (Oct 2.8%); loans to HH 2.9%, to NFCs 3.1%.
market_link: Slow-moving liquidity signal for EUR rates/FX; usually secondary for US index futures absent broader EU risk shocks.

statement: US cash close (Jan 2): MOC buy imbalance S&P +1485.3M; NQ +330.8M; Dow +432.2M; Mag7 +273.3M.
market_link: Large closing imbalances can create late-day futures dislocations and raise next-session gap sensitivity in ES/NQ.

statement: US S&P Global final mfg PMI confirmed 51.8 for Dec; in line with forecast and prior.
market_link: Low surprise content vs ISM; more sensitivity to prices/new orders subcomponents than headline confirmation.

statement: UK Dec final mfg PMI 50.6 vs flash 51.2; marginal expansion but softer than first read.
market_link: UK/Europe growth tone can influence broad risk sentiment; usually modest direct impact on US index futures.

statement: Market attention on potential Fed leadership changes ahead of Chair Powell term end (May 2026) and nomination talk.
market_link: Fed independence/leadership headlines can move front-end rates, term premium, and USD risk premia; sensitivity is episodic.
